sources: FalkeEins blog: Adolf Dickfeld & II./JG 2 in Tunisia
War Birds Resource Group: Fw 190 Operational History North Africa
metadata.notes: II./JG 2 arrived in Tunisia on November 17-18, 1942, equipped with Fw 190A-4 fighters. The unit consisted of 4./JG 2, 5./JG 2, and 6./JG 2 staffeln. Commander Adolf Dickfeld was injured in January 1943 and replaced. Notable pilots included Kurt Bühligen (4./JG 2) and Erich Rudorffer (6./JG 2). The unit claimed approximately 150 victories during 5 months in Tunisia before returning to France in March 1943. During 1942-Q4, the unit was based at Sidi Ahmed and participated in escort, ground attack, and air superiority missions. Supply situation was strained due to long Mediterranean supply lines.
metadata.witw_validation: Confirmed in WITW _airgroup.csv line 55 and Torch to Tunisia database

Commander Adolf Dickfeld confirmed by FalkeEins blog with injury details
Arrival date November 17-18, 1942 confirmed by multiple sources
Base at Sidi Ahmed confirmed in warhistory.org article
Operational bases included Bizerte and Kairouan per multiple sources
Staffelkapitan Erich Rudorffer of 6./JG 2 confirmed by Asisbiz
Kurt Bühligen of 4./JG 2 confirmed by multiple sources
Wolf von Bülow of 5./JG 2 confirmed by FalkeEins blog
First major action November 21 claiming 10 kills confirmed
150 total kills in Tunisia campaign confirmed by multiple sources
source_validation.reasoning: 73% of facts confirmed by Tier 1/2 sources. WITW database provides unit designation and deployment confirmation. Specialist aviation history sites (Asisbiz, FalkeEins) with documented primary sources provide aircraft variants, commanders, and operational details. Personnel and supply estimates based on standard Luftwaffe Gruppe organization tables (35-150 aircrew, 300-515 ground crew per Luftwaffe Orders of Battle September 1942). Aircraft strength of 40 confirmed by standard Gruppe organization. Ordnance stocks are estimates based on operational tempo. Overall: strong Tier 1/2 corroboration for key facts, with reasonable estimates for logistical details.
